description.value: Your past and current enemies may know you by reputation, but spying on you with magic is much more difficult. Whenever you attempt a saving throw against a scrying or effect, you do so at mythic proficiency. Scrying effects that attempt to observe you that don't allow saving throws to resist (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Clairaudience] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Clairvoyance]) treat you as if you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Concealed] and actively trying to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Sneak] unless they are mythic as well.

publication.title: Pathfinder #219: Lord of the Trinity Star
